WRITING.TEXT: Jesus Christ.
Thanks! Unfortunately, I don't have the code anymore but now I know what I did wrong. I just miss sims so much! lol
I wish you a speedy recovery, I've been there

WRITING.TITLE: Wondering what my best option is now?
WRITING.TEXT: I have been a long time sim addict, being in the perfect generation for growing into adulthood as the games progressed. (Oh, middle school) When I graduated high school in 2008 I got a macbook from my parents and immediately bought sims 3 and played it literally too often. Over the years I have bought most (if not all) of the expansion packs. (I also bought sims medieval which i love) Within the past year though, I haven't been able to play at all because for some reason my computer keeps saying that it's not a valid copy of sims 3, which I can honestly tell you it is. I called customer service and he said that there must be a glitch in the first disc so I should uninstall everything and then reinstall it in order. That would be only a minimal bummer if I hadn't lost the original disc (and maybe an expansion or three) a couple of years ago in a move. I guess my question now is, what is my best option? My boyfriend is pretty convinced that my laptop is getting too old for them and I mean, they ran sloooowwwww so it wouldn't surprise me. And I wouldn't want to waste the money on repurchasing multiple games if they aren't going to work. I thought you guys would have the best advice! Thanks in advance, I hope this all made sense
wow. I think you're right. Well hey, at least we're not as crazy as we thought we were cause I was beginning to think we imagined it lol. Thanks friend

WRITING.TITLE: Can anybody help me figure out which Gordon Ramsay Kitchen Nightmare episode is set at the Pirate themed restaurant?
WRITING.TEXT: My boyfriend and I have seriously been looking all over the internet for like 40 minutes and it's getting embarrassing haha. We have been craving to watch it again! Thanks in advance!
Thank you very much for that hour or so of pure enjoyment.

When I was a kid I thought it was really funny to gasp and flinch in terror whenever my dad reached for me when we were in public. In hindsight, I would start beating my kid for real if she tried to pull that shit.

When I was a very young baby my Mom had a similar run in with Jeffrey Dahmer (I'm from Milwaukee WI) at Mitchell Park. Obviously, it's a bit different because he targeted men and she was a woman, but she said she spoke with him multiple times and he was very pleasant and it just terrified her.
